title: iQPP: A Benchmark for Image Query Performance Prediction. (arXiv:2302.10126v3 [cs.CV] UPDATED)
abstract: To date, query performance prediction (QPP) in the context of content-based image retrieval remains a largely unexplored task, especially in the query-by-example scenario, where the query is an image. To boost the exploration of the QPP task in image retrieval, we propose the first benchmark for image query performance prediction (iQPP). First, we establish a set of four data sets (PASCAL VOC 2012, Caltech-101, ROxford5k and RParis6k) and estimate the ground-truth difficulty of each query as the average precision or the precision@k, using two state-of-the-art image retrieval models. Next, we propose and evaluate novel pre-retrieval and post-retrieval query performance predictors, comparing them with existing or adapted (from text to image) predictors. The empirical results show that most predictors do not generalize across evaluation scenarios. Our comprehensive experiments indicate that iQPP is a challenging benchmark, revealing an important research gap that needs to be addressed in

translated_title: iQPP：图像查询性能预测基准
translated_abstract: 到目前为止，在基于内容的图像检索中，针对查询性能预测（QPP）的研究仍然是一个较少被探索的任务，特别是在查询-by-example场景下，其中查询为图像。为了促进图像检索中QPP任务的探索，我们提出了图像查询性能预测的第一个基准（iQPP）。首先，我们建立了四个数据集（PASCAL VOC 2012， Caltech-101， ROxford5k和RParis6k），并使用两种最先进的图像检索模型估计每个查询的基本真实难度（平均准确率或precision@k）。接下来，我们提出并评估了新的预检索和后检索查询性能预测器，将它们与现有的或从文本到图像适应的预测器进行比较。实验结果表明，大多数预测器在不同的评估场景下都不能很好地推广。我们的综合实验表明，iQPP 是一个具有挑战性的基准，揭示了需要解决的重要研究空白。
tldr: iQPP是第一个在内容为图像的查询场景下探索查询性能预测的基准，其综合实验结果表明其是一个具有挑战性的基准，揭示了需要解决的重要研究空白。
